stories.title: A cup of skill – Build competitive web games using a state machine authority

stories.text:
Sorry if the title doesn't make sense, but I always work as a web developer and I wondered how do you handle testing / simulations / etc in non-web developments, especially in stuff like satellites, cars, etc.

How do you test your software? How, for example, is SpaceX software tested without launching a misile? I am sure you can test a lot with "fake" inputs but you can't be completely sure that it is going to be the same in the real scenario.

So if you want to share your insights from a not-common industry, use this thread!
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you handle “staging servers” in non-web environments?

stories.text:
After 3 weeks learning Three.js I decided to try out the CSS 3D renderer to create a parallax mock-up. This is the final result, live (Desktop only).

The rest of the site is unfinished, so any shitty UI/UX quirks WILL be fixed. I just wanted to show this off and get some general feedback.

Website: [sprintdock.app](https://sprintdock.app)
stories.title: Ask HN: Thoughts on my Three.js / CSS intro?
